The video shows a man displaying a pack: s Masala flavoured crisps and pointing to a halal logo, which certifies products as in adherence to Islamic guidelines.
The man points to an ingredient: a flavouring additive called E631, and searches the additive on his phone to show a website that claims E631 is derived from pork fat.
SANHA: a government-approved halal food certification agency in Pakistan, issued a statement refuting the claims, stating that E631 is derived from a plant extract of tropica starch.
Pepsico Pakistan: the parent company of Lay’s, also denied claims that its products contain pork, stating that all ingredients used in Lay's are 100% Halal certified by SANHA.
